captions.text:
Hey Vsauce I'm Jake and I just created a
band called Vsauce Nebula and the Hyper Manifold

or Wedding Taco of the Traditional Bean. I
haven't decided yet but you can make your

own with Band Name Maker.com and here are
14 more things you can do online now guys,
DONGs.

This image of London is the largest panoramic
photo ever taken. It is comprised of 48,640

individual images to create one gigantic 320
gigapixel photo. If you were to print it,

it would be over 321 by 78 feet in size. Because
of it's resolution you can zoom in an incredible
amount and virtually explore London.

Or you could explore over 100,000 stars, an
amazing and beautiful journey traveling light

years through the known universe. You can
learn about distant stars and see just how
small we are in comparison to everything else.

It really gives you a different perspective.
In this flash platformer that Vsaucer Nicholas

showed me, you are a dog that has to follow
your master through different challenges.

Changing your perspective will turn spikes
into coins and birds into blocks to land on.

Create your own game with sploder that Tommy
Sheets sent in. Choose what kind of game you

want to make and then add in all the assets
that you want. You can share your finished

product and also play games that other users
have made.

If your game doesn't work out then here's
a sad violin...dot com.

Just don't cry for too long because They
Will Eat You, a zombie game that has you trekking

through the woods, avoiding the undead for
as long as you can.

Escape death by going to space in NASA: Prospect.
In this fantastic interactive story, you and

your robot companion progress through our
solar system, collecting the remnants of humankind,

unraveling a really interesting story, all
to an awesome soundtrack.

But you could be like All Hail RETCON and
wait 400 Years, a flash game where you only

have 400 years to stop a disaster. If you
need to cross a body of water, you have to

wait for winter for it freezes over. If you
need to climb to a different platform, plant

a tree and wait for it to grow. You have to
be strategic with your time since it goes
by so quickly.

Or use your time machine...Jukebox Time Machine.
Play some tunes from the 1940s and look at

bomb sight.org which maps out all the bombs
dropped on London during the bomb blitz in
World War 2....which was a lot.

For something more uplifting there is peoplemov.in
which shows you the world's migration patterns.

This interactive infographic gives a really
cool snapshot of where people emigrate from
and immigrate to.

Instead of tracking the migration patterns
of humans, use Ocearch Global Shark Tracker.

You can even read the bios of these aquatic
death machines so they can lull you into a sense

of comfort before devouring you. I'm watching
you, Miguel.

If you want a different experience try Atum,
a game within a game. Items in the "real"

world are used to interact with the game world
that you are playing. Use a lighter to illuminate

sections of the game world or cigarette smoke
to block the view of security cameras.

Go to the nicest place on the internet for
a virtual hug from a stranger and subscribe
to Vsauce3 for more DONGs.

Links to everything can be found in the description
below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
